comment: Conversion Factor adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.OCF/master/Conversion/schema.json
description: Smart Data Models Program adaptation of the original IoTData data Models. This Resource describes Properties associated with the energy associated with the consumption of different fuels (including natural gas) The conversion factor is a number used as part of the calculation to convert gas volume to gas energy. The value used for this calculation is generally defined by local regulations and the conversion factor resource is therefore configurable. Provides the conversion factor used/required as part of th

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: conversion
contents.comment: Conversion factor to convert a volume of a fuel to energy consumption

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: precision
contents.comment: Accuracy granularity of the exposed value

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object

contents.name: if
contents.comment: The OCF Interfaces supported by this Resource

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
